version_description:
Hello! Team Sudo here. Taking care of a few pesky bugs and added the ability to toggle message read receipts on/off in Message Settings.

Have a favorite bug that you need smashed? Just send your feedback to support@mysudo.com and we’ll get right on it. Thanks for using MySudo!

Hello! Team Sudo here. Taking care of a few pesky bugs and added the ability to toggle message read receipts on/off in Message Settings.

Have a favorite bug that you need smashed? Just send your feedback to support@mysudo.com and we’ll get right on it. Thanks for using MySudo!

Hello! Team Sudo here. Taking care of a few pesky bugs and added the ability to toggle message read receipts on/off in Message Settings.

Have a favorite bug that you need smashed? Just send your feedback to support@mysudo.com and we’ll get right on it. Thanks for using MySudo!

Team Sudo is happy to announce that MySudo is now available in France and the United Kingdom! This means that you can now create Sudo identities with custom phone numbers and emails for these countries.

As an added bonus, we also dropped the prices for SudoGo, SudoPro and SudoMax plans—for existing and new users. Woohoo!

Team Sudo is happy to announce that MySudo is now available in France and the United Kingdom! This means that you can now create Sudo identities with custom phone numbers and emails for these countries.

As an added bonus, we also dropped the prices for SudoGo, SudoPro and SudoMax plans—for existing and new users. Woohoo!

Team Sudo is happy to announce that MySudo is now available in France and the United Kingdom! This means that you can now create Sudo identities with custom phone numbers and emails for these countries.

As an added bonus, we also dropped the prices for SudoGo, SudoPro and SudoMax plans—for existing and new users. Woohoo!

Team Sudo here with a couple of updates.

We’re happy to announce that SudoMax plan users will now be able to add up to 9 Sudo identities and phone numbers.

We’ve also added a couple of cool features to your Sudo identity cards. Simply click on the ellipsis to add some notes about your Sudo, or easily share your Sudo identity card from the app or from your device.

Lastly, SudoApp users can now transfer all of their Sudo identities to MySudo. To get started, make sure you’ve updated to the latest version of SudoApp in the Apple App Store. Then, simply open SudoApp and follow the prompts to move all of your Sudo identities to MySudo.

Hello from Team Sudo! Happy to report that notification settings are now saving correctly, and we’ve also made a couple of crash fixes.
Hello from Team Sudo! Happy to report that notification settings are now saving correctly, and we’ve also made a couple of crash fixes.
Hello from Team Sudo! Happy to report that notification settings are now saving correctly, and we’ve also made a couple of crash fixes.

Team Sudo here with exciting updates!
We’re happy to announce that MySudo now supports Video Calling for all SudoIn users. All video calls are encrypted end-to-end to ensure that your conversations stay private and secure. To start a video call, open your MySudo Contacts list, choose a SudoIn contact and click on the video icon. Invite your friends to MySudo for absolutely private, safe, secure, and FREE communications.

MySudo now allows you to select from a handful of custom chat backgrounds. Simply go to your settings, click on ‘Messages’ and choose a wallpaper.

We’ve also improved MySudo’s overall performance and speed, updated read receipt functionality and fixed some nasty bugs. Thanks for using MySudo!

If you’re loving MySudo, we’d love a review from you. If you’re not, please don’t hesitate to tell us at support@mysudo.com

A note to iOS 10 users: This is the last release that supports iOS 10. All future releases will support iOS 11 and above. So make sure you upgrade your phone!

Hello from Team Sudo! We’ve been listening to your feedback and we’re happy to announce the addition of some of our top requested features.

Here’s what’s new:

- Set a passcode, or use TouchID or FaceID to secure your MySudo app. Simply open the app and go to ‘Settings’ > ‘TouchID/FaceID & PIN’ > toggle the setting to ‘ON’ > and enter your passcode.
- Safely backup your Sudo data! It is a simple two-step process: create a password to protect your backup and then sync with iTunes or iCloud. If anything ever happens to your device, your Sudo data will be restored when you set up your replacement device using iTunes or iCloud.
- Transfer your Sudo data to another phone using a QR code. Your Sudo data is instantly available on the other device
- Create custom voicemail greetings for each of your Sudo identities. To change your voicemail greetings, open the app and go to ‘Settings’ > Choose a Sudo > ‘Voicemail Greeting’ > and customize your own message.
- Choose your audio source—including Bluetooth headphones—during an active call.
- We’ve also added a feature that saves your SMS drafts if you leave the chat before sending.

We’ve also fixed several bugs and crashes. Thanks for using MySudo!

—————

Have a favorite bug for us that you want featured above? We’d love to listen. Just send your feedback to support@mysudo.com, and we’ll do our best to accommodate.

We’ve been listening to your feedback. See our latest updates in response to your requests:

- View your Sudo details while on an active call
- Swipe through attachments in a chat from the thread details screen
- See contact name with typing bubble in group messages
- Receive multiple push notifications at once
- Enjoy 58 fewer bugs and crashes!

Have a suggestion or bug you want to see featured above? We’re all ears! Send them to support@mysudo.com

• Contacts are now auto-filtered for your existing Sudo
• Enjoy a redesigned plans screen, including a new annual plan
• Enjoy 42 fewer bugs and crashes!

Thank you for using MySudo! We update our app regularly to improve your experience. See our latest updates in response to your requests:

We’ve given MySudo an entirely new look and feel. With an improved Sudo Switcher, faster launch time and a refreshed design, MySudo is now better than ever!

• Sort your contacts by first or last name
• Enjoy our new “almost” white chat background
• Pull down to search within message, email, or contact lists
• Search global content by opening the left-drawer menu
• Tap to select a Sudo card; long press to copy specific Sudo details
• Tap the icon in the top right corner to toggle between large and small Sudo cards
• Know exactly how many free phone numbers you have left when deleting a phone number
• Enjoy improved functionality and fewer bugs


Got a favorite request you’d like to be featured? Send us an email at support@mysudo.com.

- Navigate in and out of an active call on MySudo to view content within the app
- See which Sudo is active when opening the Sudo Switcher
- View the your plans page to see exactly how many free numbers you have left
- Pull down on a list to search locally within messages, emails, and contacts
- Enjoy a tidy iOS Notifications Center after viewing corresponding content in MySudo
- Leave voicemail messages up to 90 seconds in length
- Enjoy improved functionality and fewer bugs

Thank you for using MySudo! We update our app regularly to improve your experience.

We’re happy to introduce our full-featured web browser built into MySudo. Keep your browsing history, bookmarks and tabs compartmentalized by Sudo. Stay tuned for ad and tracker blocking capabilities coming soon.

Browser
- Find the MySudo browser in the bottom right-hand corner of the navigation tab
- Open links in text messages and emails in the MySudo browser
- Tap back and forth between original messages and the web page

Email
- Compose an email and see your Sudo’s first/last name and email address above the subject field
- Expand the email header on received and sent emails to see the names and email addresses the sender and recipients
- Navigate to other tabs in the app when viewing an email and quickly navigate back without losing context

Messages
- Find text message attachment buttons in the paperclip menu when composing a text message
- Access your device’s photo library when sending a photo from a text message
- Tap on a notification from a different Sudo and automatically switch Sudos
- Navigate to other tabs in the app when viewing a text message and quickly navigate back without losing context

General
- Swipe right to return to a previous screen (finally!)
- Find the contacts tab in the left-hand menu
- Enjoy compartmentalized Sudo contacts when composing an email or text message to prevent accidental communication from the wrong Sudo
- Enjoy improved functionality and fewer bugs


Got a favorite request you’d like to be featured? Send us an email at support@mysudo.com.

Thank you for using MySudo! This update includes bug fixes and performance improvements to the following:

- Sending photos in text messages
- Restoring a large MySudo account to a new device
- Seeing unsent text messages clearly marked as ‘draft’

As always, if you run into any troubles, send us an email at support@mysudo.com

Thank you for using MySudo! We update our app regularly to improve your experience.

We’re happy to introduce landscape mode for iPad! Now MySudo is even easier to use.

This update also includes over 100 bug fixes and performance enhancements! 
- Improvements on seeing which Sudo profile is receiving a call
- Some of those pesky crashes were hunted down
- Notifications have vast improvements
- Sending/receiving of images now has a progress indicator
- Ability to turn on/off Privacy Tips & News from Team Sudo
- Enjoy improved functionality and fewer bugs

As always, if you run into any troubles, send us an email at support@mysudo.com

This update includes over 50 bug fixes and tranquility enhancements, including:
- Email zoom-in / zoom-out improvements for easier reading
- Improved email security - control download of remote images/content
- Copy/paste improvements of Bitmoji into messaging
- iOS 13 compatibility improvements
- Improvements on global notification handling
- Fixed the number pad dial tone while on call
- Improvements in landscape mode
- Incoming call notification now displays the Sudo being called

As always, if you run into any troubles, send us an email at support@mysudo.com

Thank you for using MySudo! We update our app regularly to improve your experience.

This update includes over 40 enhancements and bug fixes including:

- Enable the new Ad and Tracker Blocking feature in the Private Browser to greatly enhance your privacy.
- Remote content in emails (e.g. images) no longer load automatically, giving you more control over your privacy.
- See which Sudo profile is being called on the incoming call notification.
- Copy and paste images and Bitmojis directly into text messages.
- The number pad on the phone dialer correctly plays the touch tone during on a call.
- Notifications have been updated to conform with underlying iOS 13 notification changes.
- iPad landscape mode received multiple updates to improve the iPad experience.
- Several annoying crashes were fixed.

As always, if you run into any troubles, send us an email at support@mysudo.com

Thank you for using MySudo! We update our app regularly to improve your experience.

This update includes over 40 enhancements and bug fixes including:

- Enable the new Ad and Tracker Blocking feature in the Private Browser to greatly enhance your privacy.
- Remote content in emails (e.g. images) no longer load automatically, giving you more control over your privacy.
- See which Sudo profile is being called on the incoming call notification.
- Copy and paste images and Bitmojis directly into text messages.
- The number pad on the phone dialer correctly plays the touch tone during on a call.
- Notifications have been updated to conform with underlying iOS 13 notification changes.
- iPad landscape mode received multiple updates to improve the iPad experience.
- Several annoying crashes were fixed.

As always, if you run into any troubles, send us an email at support@mysudo.com

Thank you for using MySudo! We update our app regularly to improve your experience.

In this update we are excited to be introducing our secure payments capability, MySudo virtual cards!

In today’s digital world it is paramount to protect and keep private your personal credit and debit card details from hackers, trackers, and bad actors. MySudo virtual cards* puts you in control of your information. Virtual cards can be used to make purchases from online merchants, retailers, and services using the virtual card's details (i.e. 16 digit card number, expiration date, and CVV). Using a virtual card for your purchases, instead of your regular credit or debit card, keeps your personal card details safe, private, and secure!

You will find the MySudo virtual cards feature in the bottom right part of navigation bar for all your Sudo profiles. Tap the card icon and follow the steps to enable this new capability. We are currently working on more enhancements and additional funding sources for virtual cards, stay tuned! You can read more about MySudo virtual cards on our website: Blog and FAQ

We have made many improvements and bug fixes in this update as well, here are the more visible ones:

• Improvements to global notifications 
• Improvements to alert sounds and vibration when using default sounds for message and email notifications 
• Enhancement to area code handling for messaging 
• Improvements to browser and site handling 
• Improvement to browser with user’s whitelist domains settings being maintained after App launch 
• Enhancement to browser enabling long press links and option to copy link 
• Enhancement to email enabling long press links and option to copy 
• Improvements to “Select All” and “Read All” features for email 
• Improvements for calls from “No Caller ID” callers 
• Improvements to App onboarding 
• MySudo for Web session connection improvements 
• And of course, we nailed a few crashes  

As always, if you run into any troubles or have a favourite request you’d like to be featured, send us an email at support@mysudo.com or post your feature request directly on the MySudo Community.
 
*MySudo virtual cards only available in the U.S.

Thank you for using MySudo! We update our app regularly to improve your experience.

We have made many improvements and bug fixes in this update, here are the more visible ones:

• Introducing the ability to Silence Unknown Callers!
If you don’t want to receive calls from numbers that are not in your contacts, you can silence them on a per Sudo basis by enabling “Silence Unknown Callers” in Settings
• Updated our backup and restore capabilities
If you haven't done so already, go and set a Recovery Password today in the MySudo settings so you don't lose your Sudos and data!
• Fixed - Incoming calls now respect the call notifications settings on iPad
• Fixed - Message status indicator ticks show correctly on sending device
• Fixed - Save an email as draft
• We also nailed down a few crashes!

As always, if you run into any troubles or have a feature request you’d like to make, please send us an email at support@mysudo.com or post your feature request directly on the MySudo Community.

Thank you for using MySudo! We update our app regularly to improve your experience.

• MySudo Dark Mode is finally here! Designed to make the app better to use day or night - your preference! Reduce eyestrain, enhance focus, and improve battery life.
• Search result improvements.
• iPad formatting improvements for landscape view.
• Email formatting improvements.
• A few bugs were squashed.

As always, if you run into any troubles or have a favorite request you’d like to be featured, send us an email at support@mysudo.com or post your feature request directly to the MySudo Community.

Thank you for using MySudo! We update our app regularly to improve your experience.

• Did you know that we offer encrypted video calling to other MySudo users? Start a call directly from a messaging conversation or from your Sudo contact lists with this update.
• Dynamic font support has been improved to support the iOS accessiblility font size settings across the app.
• A few enhancements to dark mode for areas like email viewing with more to come soon.
• We squashed a few bugs as well!

As always, if you run into any troubles or have a favorite request you’d like to be featured, send us an email at support@mysudo.com or post your feature request directly to the MySudo Community.

Thank you for using MySudo! We update our app regularly to improve your experience. The latest MySudo iOS release is available and includes:

• MySudo for iOS now supports Group Video Calling! Video chat with up to 5 MySudo users and enjoy end-to-end encryption with private and secure video calls.
• We squashed a few bugs along the way as well.

As always, if you run into any issues or have a feature request you’d like to see in MySudo, send us an email at support@mysudo.com or post your feature request directly to the MySudo Community.
